P_gtree.h

00001 /*
00002  *  P_GTREE.H
00003  *
00004  *      Include file with the definitions needed to access the
00005  *  generic tree subroutines module P_GTree.C
00006  *
00007  *      Requires PORTABLE.H, P_LIST.H and, hence, P_TYPES.H
00008  *
00009  *      Notes: NOW it contains the type definitions as well
00010  *
00011  *      Designed by:
00012  *          J. R. Valverde      8  - apr - 1990
00013  */
00014 
00015 #ifndef info_t
00016 #define info_t  void
00017 #endif
00018 
00019 #define MAX     10          /* Maximum number of nodes in an N-ary tree */
00020 
00021 
00022 /*----------------------------------------------------------------*/
00023 
00024 /* node structure for a binary tree */
00025 
00026 struct binary_node {
00027     info_t              *element;       /* node's data */
00028     struct binary_node  *left;          /* left child node */
00029     struct binary_node  *right;         /* right child node */
00030     struct binary_node  *parent;        /* parent node */
00031 };
00032 
00033 typedef struct binary_node *b_tree_t;
00034 
00035 /*----------------------------------------------------------------*/
00036 
00037 /* node structure for three children by node */
00038           
00039 struct triple_node {
00040     info_t              *element;
00041     struct triple_node  *left;
00042     struct triple_node  *middle;
00043     struct triple_node  *right;
00044     struct triple_node  *parent;
00045 };
00046 
00047 typedef struct triple_node *t_tree_t;
00048 
00049 /*-----------------------------------------------------------------*/
00050 
00051 /* for more than three nodes it is better to use an array of nodes.
00052    This array may be built as an array of pointers to child nodes
00053     as follows:
00054 */
00055 
00056 /* node structure for a fixed number of children nodes (MAX) */
00057 
00058 struct n_ary_node {
00059     info_t          *element;       /* node's data */
00060     struct n_ary_node *child[MAX];  /* array of children nodes */
00061     struct n_ary_node *parent;      /* parent node */
00062 };
00063 
00064 typedef struct n_ary_node *n_tree_t;
00065 
00066 /*---------------------------------------------------------------*/
00067 
00068 /* node structure for an arbitrary number of children */
00069 
00070 struct dynamic_node {
00071     info_t              *element;       /* node's data */
00072     struct list_t       *children;      /* header of the list of childs */
00073     struct dynamic_node *parent;        /* parent node */
00074 };
00075 
00076 typedef struct dynamic_node *g_tree_t;  /* generic tree */
00077 
00078 /*----------------------------------------------------------------*/
00079 
00080 /* structure of a node for a linked list of trees (a forest) */
00081 
00082 struct forest_node {
00083     g_tree_t            *fst_item;
00084     struct forest_node  *fst_next;
00085 };
00086 
00087 typedef struct forest_node forest_n_t;
00088 
00089 /* header for a linked list of trees (forest) */
00090 
00091 struct forest_head {
00092     int         fst_len;
00093     forest_n_t  *fst_first, *fst_last;
00094 };
00095 
00096 typedef struct forest_head *forest_t;
00097 
00098 /*
00099  * Generic tree manipulation subroutines.
00100  */
00101 
00102 extern g_tree_t init_gtree(info_t *, g_tree_t);
00103 
00104 extern g_tree_t new_gtree(info_t *);
00105 
00106 extern bool add_child(info_t *, g_tree_t);
00107 
00108 extern bool add_sibling(info_t *, g_tree_t);
00109 
00110 extern l_node_t *leftmost(g_tree_t);
00111 
00112 extern g_tree_t root(g_tree_t);
00113 
00114 extern is_leaf(g_tree_t);
00115 
00116 extern void pre_order(g_tree_t, void (*)());
00117 
00118 extern void in_order(g_tree_t, void (*)());
00119 
00120 extern void post_order(g_tree_t, void (*)());
